translation.en: -your blood pressure looks good. -[machine beeps]
Now we're gonna do the thing where I ask you some basic health questions and you lie to me.
Okay?
Alcoholic beverages per week?
Two, maybe three.
Why you lying to me, Carl?
Would you also like to lie to me about smoking?
I stopped smoking.
Carl, the mouthwash works, but the shirt smells like...
translation.ko: 칼, 입은 헹궈도 옷에 밴 냄새는...

translation.en: Virginia Slims?
They make my hands look bigger.
I'm not gonna write that down on the chart.
Dr. Berkowitz will be here in a minute, okay?
Hey, uh, what's that picture? Is that Halloween?
Oh, no. I think this was closer to Christmas.
But you're wearing army clothes.
Yes, I know.
The camouflage look was all the rage in Afghanistan.
You went to Afghanistan for Christmas.
I'ma give you a sec.
-Oh! -There you go!
-Let me ask you-- -No, I never killed anyone.
translation.ko: - 궁금한 게... - 아뇨, 사람 안 죽였고

translation.en: Yes, it was hot over there. You're welcome for my service.
translation.ko: 네, 무지 더웠고 할 일을 했을 뿐이에요

translation.en: Anything else?
Well, I was just gonna ask you, is your husband also a badass soldier?
Oh, yeah, he was.
-[gasps] Oh, my God, I'm sorry! -[laughs] Oh...
No, he... he was a badass soldier,
but now he does private security in Afghanistan.
But any... anyways, we're separated.
So, you're single. [chuckles]
Yeah.
Actually, I was just about to go home and make dinner for my kids.
Single mom.
Well, this was fun.
Alex.
Alex, help.
Papito, let's go! You know I got a bum shoulder.
translation.ko: 빨리 안 와? 어깨 아픈 거 알면서

translation.en: I need help over here.
Thank you.
Next time I'll Skype you.
We have a problem.
I know. The hipsters have discovered Porto's.
Line around the block is like the freakin' Apple Store now.
Mom!
And this one, I don't like her anymore.
translation.ko: 그리고 이 녀석 정이 똑 떨어졌다

translation.en: I don't care if you like me.
Sounds like you're both on the same page.
Your daughter does not want to have a quinces.
What? Why?
We already booked the room, and I found a great band!
Okay, it's a deejay.
Okay, it's your brother with an iPod and a playlist,
translation.ko: 그래, 네 동생이 아이팟 돌리는 거지만

translation.en: but it's a very good playlist.
I researched the history of quinceañeras
and found out they're totally misogynistic.
She's been reading again. Why do you let her read?
translation.ko: 또 책을 읽었구나 왜 글을 가르쳤니?

translation.en: I know, Mami. I let her do math, too. I'm a monster.
translation.ko: 수학까지 배우게 했으니 난 사람도 아니야

translation.en: By the way, they made me captain of the debate team today at school,
but all she wants to talk about is this.
She has to have a quinces.
How else will we know the day that our little girl becomes a woman?
translation.ko: 우리 애가 여인이 되는 날을 알 수가 없잖아

translation.en: You missed it.
I was 12, I was in gym,
and ironically, it happened in first period.
You are throwing away your Cuban heritage.
Yeah, the bad part.
I don't want to be paraded around in front of the men of the village
like a piece of property to be traded for two cows and a goat.
Someone thinks they're worth a lot.
What century do you two think you're in?
I mean, Elena, relax. It's just a fun party.
translation.ko: 엘레나, 걱정 마 그냥 재밌는 파티야

translation.en: You know, I'll have a little too much wine,
embarrass you while I sob during my toast,
translation.ko: 질질 짜서 널 쪽팔리게 할 거고

translation.en: uh, Abuelita will dance inappropriately with one of your guy friends--
translation.ko: 할머닌 네 남자 친구들과 낯뜨거운 춤을 출 거야

translation.en: You can count on it.
I'm not doing it.
You need to do something about this little sinvergüenza.
What does that even mean?
It means...
that you do not know enough Spanish to know that I'm insulting you.
translation.ko: 욕인지도 모를 만큼 네 스페인어가 엉망이란 뜻

translation.en: -[laughs] -Abuelita...
[in English] I'll learn more Spanish when you learn English.
translation.ko: 할머니가 영어 배우면 나도 스페인어 배울게요

translation.en: I know the English.
Besides, your abuelo, God rest his soul, did not marry me for my mind.
translation.ko: 돌아가신 네 할아버지가 내 지성에 반한 건 아니란다

translation.en: Who do you think you're insulting?
Good one, Mom.
By the way, what are the last 16 digits of your credit card?
Uh, what are you doing?
Are you shopping? 'Cause who said you could shop?
You said I could order sneakers for school.
translation.ko: 학교 갈 때 신을 운동화 사라며

translation.en: [laughs] Five pairs?
Monday through Friday.
Don't worry, I don't need weekend sneakers.
[chuckles] Oh, well...
I can't have my son walking around in Monday sneakers on a Saturday.
Somebody might call child services.
Mom, I'm serious.
I'm in middle school now. How I look kinda matters.
Okay, so you can buy one pair for under $40.
Forty?
That'll get you perfectly good sneakers to last the whole year.
translation.ko: 1년 내내 신을 좋은 운동화 살 수 있어

translation.en: The whole year?
Okay, Mom, I know we're not rich, but are we poor?
translation.ko: 우리가 부자 아닌 건 아는데 설마 가난해?

translation.en: No, we're... fine.
-That sounds like poor. -We're not poor!
I mean, look around!
We have a TV, a refrigerator. You have a laptop.
translation.ko: TV도 있고 냉장고도 있고 노트북도 있어

translation.en: These are things that poor people have.
We have an air conditioner.
You never let us turn it on.
The point is you could, but don't. Don't ever touch that thing.
translation.ko: 켤 수 있다는 게 중요하지 손도 대지 마라

translation.en: All right, it's Friday night. Family dinner time. Come on, let's go!
Elena, come set the table! Alex, help me make a salad.
translation.ko: 엘레나, 상 차려 알렉스, 샐러드 만들자

translation.en: This meat was heavily discounted, so I need to cook it before it turns.
translation.ko: 할인하는 고기 산 거라 상하기 전에 먹어야 돼

translation.en: You guys already ate, didn't you?
She made ropa vieja.
I'm not made of stone.
Mami, I told you this morning that I was gonna cook tonight.
I thought it was a joke!
And I thought it was hilarious.
Sorry, Mom. Do you want us to sit and watch you eat?
translation.ko: 미안해, 엄마 엄마 먹는 거 봐줄까?

translation.en: No. [chuckles]
We'll just start next Friday.
-Okay? -Okay.
-All right. -Sounds good.
So, there is some ropa vieja in the mantequilla thing
translation.ko: 로파 비에하 남은 거 버터통에 있다

translation.en: if you don't want to eat that... sad meat.
I bought it, I'm eating it.
-Okay. -[pipes groaning]
Oh, yeah, that's not working.
Don't worry, I told Schneider.
Here's some hand sanitizer.
And here...
-I don't need lipstick. -Yes, you do.
Okay.
You know how much I appreciate your help,
but you have to let me establish my own traditions.
translation.ko: 나만의 전통을 만들 수 있게 해줘

translation.en: [bangs table] I agree. So let's talk quinces.
Ay, Mami, ya! I don't wanna force her.
You know, this is all on me now. I wanna handle it right.
translation.ko: 이제 내 책임이니까 제대로 하고 싶어

translation.en: You know...
a father would make sure that his little girl had a quinces.
translation.ko: 아빠라면 어린 딸한테 이렇게 끌려다니지 않지

translation.en: You really wanna go there? 'Cause I'm holding a hammer.
translation.ko: 자꾸 긁을 거야? 망치 들고 있는데

translation.en: I'm just saying, maybe when Victor comes back, you can work it out.
Remember when we all moved in together and you said,
translation.ko: 엄마 우리랑 합치면서 했던 말 기억나?

translation.en: "If you ever want me to go away, just say, 'Go away.'"
[Lydia in English] You're welcome!
Schneider!
Well, you grew out that mustache, huh?
Yeah, I finally took the plunge and went full handlebar.
Feelin' really good about it.
I feel like it says, "I mean business."
Yes, if your business is taming lions.
Oh, wait! I have one more.
You're 40 and you look stupid.
I knew it!
[laughs] What? Is... That's fake?
Yeah, I'm not gonna grow a real one until I know if people like it.
And I'll have you know, I was invited to several pride parades.
Please tell me you're here to fix my sink.
Yeah, fine!
-Ooh, that's a cool hammer. -Uh, careful.
That's very expensive Damascus steel.
Ah, so we've got two fancy tools up in here.
No, come on. Come on! No.
You know you're the only non-Latino I trust to fix stuff.
Oh, is that racist? Oh, who cares, it's just us. [chuckles]
-[speaks Spanish] -[in English] Yeah, don't do that. I regretted it as soon as I said it.
It's no problem. I can get that done by tonight.
Maybe after dinner. What's your mom cookin'?
You've really been eating here a lot lately.
Yeah, I like it, too.
Can you believe it's only been 10 months since you moved in?
translation.ko: 이사 온 지 열 달밖에 안 됐다니 믿어져요?

translation.en: I remember 'cause I got my five year sober chip
translation.ko: 그날 술 끊은 지 5년 된 기념으로

translation.en: and your mom baked me that cake.
Oh, I remember, yeah. I'm sorry it was a rum cake.
I enjoyed watching you guys eat it.
Oh, by the way...
looks like you accidentally threw these out.
-I found 'em in the trash. -Hmm.
Wonder how they got there.
Hey... listen, you can tell me anything.
There's a landlord-tenant confidentiality clause in your lease.
No, there isn't.
Okay, there's not, but I really wanna know what's going on!
Fine. They're anti-depressants that Dr. Berkowitz thought I might need,
but he doesn't know what he's talking about, so...
Yeah, it sounds like he really cares about you.
What a dick!
I don't need them, and I have to get them out of here
translation.ko: 그런 거 필요 없다고요 당장 치워야 해요

translation.en: because if my mom finds 'em, it'll be, [inhales deeply]
[imitates Lydia] "Ay, Dios mío, she's a junkie like the Amy Winehouser."
Yeah, so, I will, uh...
I'll just get that washer and we'll get that thing fixed right up.
Oh! Hello, Schneider.
Hola, señora.
Oh, you shave out your mustache.
-What, you liked it? -Oh, yes. It made me laugh.
Elena!
-[in English] Come out here, honey. -What's up, Abuelita?
Okay, listen, uh... [clears throat]
I know you got issues with the quinces, but--
-All right... -No, no, no. No, no.
-[sighs] -But I am going to show you something...
that I think might change your mind.
This could be you.
Mommy, please, put those away. I hate those pictures. Burn it!
translation.ko: 엄마, 그 사진 너무 싫어 태워버려!

translation.en: Oh, hey! The quinceañera. You're doing it!
Elena, I knew you'd come around.
She didn't! She thinks she's being sold into slavery.
That's not really part of it, right?
You know what? Let me talk to her. [grunts]
I've been doing some outreach down at the rec center,
talking to at-risk youth.
No, I don't think you should do that.
Hey, girl.
How you livin'?
Your abuela wants to throw you a sick kick-back on a Saturday night.
translation.ko: 너네 할멈이 토욜에 쩌는 파티 땡겨준다며

translation.en: You know, keep it hundred.
You down?
What's happening right now?
Schneider, she's gonna do it. I got this.
You know what, Captain Debater? Let's debate this.
But we're not doing a regular debate. It's gotta be that thing I saw you do
translation.ko: 그냥 하면 재미없으니까 네가 했던 거 중에

translation.en: where we argue the opposite side to better understand each other.
translation.ko: 상대방 입장이 돼서 얘기하는 거 있지?

translation.en: You mean a Lincoln-Douglas debate? My specialty?
I once successfully argued against gravity, so...
Ooh, I'ma take my earrings off...
'cause it's about to go down!
The issue before us is quinces or no quinces.
Okay...
so I'm you.
[imitates Penelope] Mmm, listen kid!
A quinces is just about the village celebrating that you're a woman,
translation.ko: 킨세스는 여자가 된 걸 온 동네가 축하해주는 거야

translation.en: which I know you know 'cause you're the smartest one in the family!
[laughs] Oh, I got better moves than that, right?
But village isn't literal.
It just means your family and your friends.
So, what's so bad about this modern village
coming together to celebrate you?
-Oh, yeah! She's good. -Oh.
Oh, my money's on her.
[chuckles] You guys wanna start takin' bets?
Actually, scratch that. I'm addicted to gambling.
translation.ko: 못 들은 걸로 해요 도박 중독이라서

translation.en: Okay, now I'll be you.
[imitates Elena] Oh, my God!
Do you even hear yourself? Seriously!
Your argument is that my adulthood has to be approved by your friends?
translation.ko: 왜 내가 어른 되는 걸 엄마 친구들한테 인정받아?

translation.en: Pass!
Well, I'm not gonna clap for that.
[in Spanish accent] So you want to crush my heart into pieces...
after I worked so hard to give you an opportunity
translation.ko: 자유와 용기의 땅에 너희를 살게 하려고

translation.en: in this land of the free and home of the brave?
That's not me, that's her.
You make me sound like I have an accent.
[clears throat] Let's end this. Elena,
you wrecked your first communion because, as a vegetarian,
translation.ko: 첫 영성체 망친 건 네가 채식주의자라서

translation.en: you wouldn't eat the body of Christ.
You even refused to take any pictures with Santa
because your abuelita wouldn't admit that Christmas is a pagan ritual.
translation.ko: 크리스마스가 이교도 의식인 걸 할머니가 인정 안해서였지

translation.en: Jesus and Santa were cousins. Everybody knows this.
translation.ko: 예수와 산타는 사촌이야 누구나 아는 사실이지

translation.en: So, when it comes to your quinces...
I'm pleading with you.
Can't you do this one thing for your mother who loves you?
translation.ko: 널 사랑하는 엄마를 위해 이거 하나도 못 해?

translation.en: Okay, Mom, I'll do it.
Wait, what?
I'm saying, you win!
You should have a quinces like you just proved.
Dang! Mami set you up!
I didn't realize how right I was.
She said a bunch of stuff I didn't even think of!
translation.ko: 난 생각도 못 한 걸 막 얘기하더라

translation.en: Mami, [speaks Spanish].
Okay, this was stupid! I'm still not having a quinces.
translation.ko: 이런 게 어딨어? 아무리 그래도 안 해

translation.en: Oh, God, just accept it. You're Cuban, you're 15,
you're gonna have a big party, with a poofy dress and a bad photo.
translation.ko: 그냥 인정해, 쿠바인이고 15살이니까 파티하는 거야 부풀린 드레스 입고 굴욕 사진도 남기고

translation.en: It's what we do.
translation.ko: 부풀린 드레스 입고 굴욕 사진도 남기고

translation.en: [in English] She can speak Spanish.
Mrs. Doyle is in exam room three
and I swear to God, if that vieja calls me Maria one more time...
translation.ko: 그놈의 할망구 날 또 마리아라고 불러봐!

translation.en: Mrs. Doyle has Alzheimer's.
Oh, no, I'm so sorry.
Hey, I'm messin' with ya. She's just racist.
What's going on with you today? You're... you're all on edge.
I had to put my foot down with Elena about her quinces, and...
I'm not sure if I did the right thing. She wouldn't talk to me all weekend.
translation.ko: 잘한 건지 모르겠어요 저랑 말도 안 하려고 해요

translation.en: Oh, don't worry. It gets better.
Eventually they leave.
[groans] It's just all on me now.
Oh, yeah, every move you make is fraught with peril.
Is this gonna be the one that scars them for life?
And in my case, the answer was always yes.
translation.ko: 내 경우엔 우려가 꼭 현실이 됐죠

translation.en: Well, it's just a lot of pressure and sometimes...
I don't know.
Did you ever take those--
No, no. I threw them right in the trash. It's fine!
There's just a lot going on right now.
translation.ko: 신경 쓸 게 많아서 그런 거예요

translation.en: But it's more than that, right?
You were talking to me about nightmares--
I know what I said.
Look, if...
if you had something wrong with your heart,
and I gave you some medicine, you would take it.
So why wouldn't you do the same with this?
Yeah.
But to be fair, I probably wouldn't take that heart crap either.
I mean, as a nurse, I would totally recommend it,
but as a Cuban, I suffer in silence.
A silent Cuban? Hey, I'd like to meet one of those.
translation.ko: 조용한 쿠바인? 그게 뭔가요? 먹는 건가요?

translation.en: -And she's a teenager, right? -Right.
At least I'm safe for another year with the little one.
-Oh! Your phone telling you things. -Oh, yeah.
Alex ordered some sneakers for school.
I get an alert every time a package is delivered.
How many feet does that kid have?
Hey, so, for the quinces, is there any way I can get a plus three?
translation.ko: 킨세스 참석할 때 세 명 추가 가능한가요?

translation.en: Currently in a bit of a... lady-juggling situation.
No, I promised you to Consuelo. [laughs]
Now, she has a good mustache.
Just kidding. [laughs]
It's not that good.
Alex.
Alex!
He can't hear you!
-[door closes] -He is possessed by the YouTube.
-I can explain. -[Penelope] Really?
You can explain how one pair of sneakers magically became five?
Because that is some Jesus crap right there.
Sorry I said Jesus so close to the word crap.
translation.ko: 예수님이랑 똥을 한 문장에 써서 미안

translation.en: Mom, this family's been through a lot, and I felt like I needed to provide...
translation.ko: 엄마, 사연 많은 우리 가족을 이젠 내가 책임질게

translation.en: because I'm the man of the house now.
Oh, that's why you bought five pairs of sneakers?
That's why I bought no pairs of sneakers.
Oh, he's into magic now? [laughs]
Can I be your assistant? [laughs]
No, I will become the focus.
Free returns, Mom.
I can order any pair I want, wear them a couple of times.
translation.ko: 몇 켤레를 주문하든 서너 번 신고 나서

translation.en: As long as I keep them clean, I can send them right back.
I know you wanna be mad, but that's genius.
No, it's not.
Alex, there's no way you can keep all these sneakers
-clean enough to send back. -Oh, no?
Oh, so, it's six pairs of shoes?
Okay, what about the bottoms? You've been walking around all day.
translation.ko: 그럼 신발 바닥은? 종일 걸어 다니잖아

translation.en: Oh, you're right, Mom.
I mean, you gotta get him on Shark Tank or something.
No. No, this ends now. It's like you're stealing.
translation.ko: 아니, 이제 그만해 도둑질 같은 거야

translation.en: Exactly! It's like I'm stealing.
No, you're not charming your way out of this.
I said one new pair. You disobeyed me.
translation.ko: 한 켤레 사랬는데 말 안 들었으니까

translation.en: Now, you get no new pairs.
No, you know what? Now, you get Elena's old sparkly ones.
With the multicultural princesses?
No!
Lucky for you, she never wore them 'cause they were too gender-specific.
translation.ko: 성 편향적인 거 싫다며 안 신어서 깨끗해

translation.en: She did like that they were diverse.
I'm not wearing those.
I still don't understand why I can't buy these.
translation.ko: 이걸 왜 못 사게 하는지 이해가 안 돼

translation.en: Don't you have more money now that Papi's gone?
translation.ko: 아빠 없어서 돈은 더 많지 않아?

translation.en: [scoffs] What?
Well, you have a job, plus Papi gives you money, right?
translation.ko: 엄마도 직장 있고 아빠도 돈 줄 텐데?

translation.en: So that's, like, double money.
Sit down.
-[sighs] -Let me talk to him.
-Hey, little man... Okay. -Out!
Yes, your papi gives me money,
but it's for the basics, and it's not a lot.
But he's absolutely doing his best, and he will always be your papi.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 아빠는 최선을 다해 네 아빠 노릇 할 거야

translation.en: But make no mistake, when it comes to money,
I'm your daddy.
Tomorrow, these all go back.
-Everything okay? -[sighs]
I need you to sign my test.
Yes, everything is fine. At least you're talking to me now.
translation.ko: 별일 아니야 네가 말 걸었으니 됐어

translation.en: It says you got a D.
I know.
This is social studies. You love this!
Yeah. I guess I didn't try
because I don't need an education now that I'm gonna be chattel.
translation.ko: 가재도구 취급이나 받을 텐데 공부는 무슨

translation.en: And without schoolwork, I have more time to plan my magical quinces. So...
translation.ko: 공부 안 하면 킨세스 준비할 시간도 늘잖아

translation.en: [sighs] Ay. Okay.
Enough.
Yes, you keep that up, and you will not have a quinces.
translation.ko: 이런 식으로 할 거면 킨세스고 뭐고 없어

translation.en: Wait...
I can't believe you.
You know how hard I bust my ass, by myself, to send you to that school
translation.ko: 내가 얼마나 기를 써서 널 그 학교에 보내는데

translation.en: so that you can have more opportunities than I did.
Then you... you pull this crap?
I can't even look at you right now. Just go to your room.
translation.ko: 꼴도 보기 싫어 네 방으로 가

translation.en: You keep saying that
you want me to be this strong, independent woman like you.
translation.ko: 엄마처럼 강하고 독립적인 여자가 되라고 하면서

translation.en: And then, when I tell you that I don't want to be a part of something
that I think is a misogynist cultural ritual,
you tell me to shut up, do it anyway.
[scoffs] So which is it, Mom?
Lupita, are you okay?
Ah, you're like me.
You get upset and you clean.
Wait, wait a minute. Wait, what... what is that?
It's an anti-depressant that I'm gonna be taking. -[gasps] -So just deal with it.
translation.ko: 우울증 약이야 먹을 거니까 그런 줄 알아

translation.en: That is your answer? Drugs?
Okay, open your mouth and spit it in my hand.
translation.ko: 자, 입 벌리고 내 손에 뱉어

translation.en: I haven't even taken it yet!
And it's okay, Mom. It's something that helps.
translation.ko: 걱정 마, 엄마 도움이 될 거야

translation.en: But do you even see everything that's happening now?
You don't need drugs. You need your husband.
Oh, God, stop it!
Stop. Victor is not the answer.
I know you didn't want him to go back to Afghanistan,
translation.ko: 아프간에 다시 간 빅터가 못마땅한 건 아는데

translation.en: but he's making money.
He's being a good provider.
There are jobs here where they don't shoot at you.
translation.ko: 여기서 일하면 총 맞을 걱정도 없지

translation.en: We live in America, name one!
It's not just the job, and you know that!
-It's not like he cheated on you. -It's not the only thing that matters.
translation.ko: 바람을 피운 것도 아니잖아 그것만 아니면 돼?

translation.en: We are Cuban. We don't get divorced, we die.
Don't you think I miss him?
You think I like being alone?
I wanted to do this with somebody. That was the plan.
translation.ko: 이런 거 다 누구랑 같이 할 계획이었어

translation.en: Family dinners, and inside jokes,
and one of the kids says something cute, and you share a look.
translation.ko: 애들이 이쁜 짓 하면 같이 웃고...

translation.en: And even right now to be able to say, "Okay, they're insane, we're not."
translation.ko: 지금 같은 땐 애들 나무라고 내 편 돼주고

translation.en: A partner.
[voice breaking] Someone to love. Someone...
someone in your bed.
You know, since Victor's gone, I don't sleep.
translation.ko: 빅터 떠난 후로 잠도 못 자

translation.en: Because he used to spoon me to sleep. So, yeah, Mom...
translation.ko: 전엔 잠들 때까지 백허그 해줬거든, 맞아

translation.en: I miss the good stuff.
Sometimes you just need somebody to give you a hug
translation.ko: 누가 안아주면서 이런 말 해주면 좋겠어

translation.en: and say, "I got you."
I meant a man.
I am very strong.
I've been doing my yoga.
I got you.
[Penelope] Hey.
The ladies be looking at your feet. Something's wrong.
Am I right?
I'm sorry.
Nah, I think I can make these work.
Or, I noticed you bought a pair for under 40 bucks,
which means you did the right thing before you did the many, many wrong things.
translation.ko: 엄마 말을 들은 다음 사고를 여러 개 친 거였어

translation.en: Really? Oh, thank you!
I was trying to be brave,
but even the nuns would've made fun of me.
Listen, you don't have to worry about being the man of the house.
translation.ko: 이 집 가장 되려고 애쓸 거 없어

translation.en: First of all, we don't have a house, so there's that.
translation.ko: 일단 우린 집이 없으니 얘기 끝이지

translation.en: You just be a twelve-year-old boy, okay?
Okay.
And you're right, I shouldn't worry too much about what's going on down here,
translation.ko: 엄마 말이 맞아 신발은 걱정할 거 없겠더라고

translation.en: when I got so much going on up here.
Puberty's gonna hit you like a train.
Hey.
Hello.
So there's been a lot of yelling.
Okay, it was mostly me.
But I hear you... and you don't have to have a quinces.
translation.ko: 네 말에 따를게 킨세스 안 해도 돼

translation.en: Oh, thank you. Thank you, thank you, thank you.
Yeah, and this is not because of that crap you pulled with the test.
translation.ko: 시험으로 장난질 쳐서 그런 거 아니야

translation.en: You do that again and I'll put my quinces tiara on you while you sleep,
translation.ko: 또 그러면 잘 때 내 킨세스 왕관 씌워서

translation.en: and post it to your Instagram. Don't test me.
translation.ko: 네 인스타에 올릴 거야 빈말 아니다

translation.en: Okay.
Look, I get the whole misogynist thing. I do.
translation.ko: 네가 말한 여성 혐오적인 부분 공감해

translation.en: But I hate to tell you lots of good stuff has started for dumb man reasons.
translation.ko: 입에 담긴 싫지만 그런 남자들 덕에 좋은 것도 많이 생겼어

translation.en: Yeah, like, marriage used to be a way to pay off debts.
Plus, women were being raped everywhere,
so you'd marry your daughter off to some guy and say,
"Okay, he owns her now. No raping this one."
translation.ko: ‘얜 이놈 소유니까 강간 금지!’ 한 거야

translation.en: My point is we've made progress.
I didn't know you were such a feminist, Mom.
I can assemble a rifle in 13 seconds. I'm a total badass.
translation.ko: 이래 봬도 13초 만에 소총 조립하는 여자야

translation.en: How are you missing this?
[chuckles] I'm sorry, it's just a lot of times you sound like a mom.
translation.ko: 미안해, 그냥 엄마로만 보일 때도 많아서

translation.en: Yeah, well, I am one.
And there is a part of me that buys into that cheesy
"my little girl is becoming a woman" thing,
because you're not a little girl anymore.
That is super weird. [sighs]
If I'm being honest with myself, I was making your quinces about me.
I guess I wanted people to show up and say,
"Look at the amazing single mom pulling it all together by herself."
I know. It was dumb.
It's not dumb. They're dumb.
-Who? -The people.
No, there's no people, that's just a thing that I said.
translation.ko: 뭐라 한 사람 없어 말이 그렇다는 거지

translation.en: No, I'll do it.
All I wanted was a good reason why, and you just gave me one.
translation.ko: 그럴듯한 이유가 필요했던 것뿐인데 방금 생겼어

translation.en: Oh, my God, really?
[laughing] That is so great!
We'll... we'll do the whole thing. The ceremony, the stupid waltz.
We're gonna show them what single mothers can pull off.
I will dress like a child bride for you, Mom.
translation.ko: 엄마가 원한다면 꼬마 신부 옷도 입을게

translation.en: Okay, now I feel like I should talk you out of it. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 이쯤에서 고삐를 당겨줘야 할 것 같네

translation.en: Yeah, but I won't. I won't.
Your abuelita, she can be a broken record, but she taught me life can be tough.
translation.ko: 할머니가 잔소리는 심해도 피가 되는 가르침도 주셨어

translation.en: So when you get something to celebrate, you take it.
Then take photos.
Photos I'll use to scare your children.
Oh, I'm not having children.
Not today.
Move over.
What?
What are you doing here?
-I'm going to spoon you. -No.
-Yes, move over. -Mami, no!
-Okay, shh! -No!
-You're gonna like this. It's very nice. -No, don't do it.
translation.ko: - 해보면 기분 좋을걸 - 아냐, 하지 마

translation.en: -Oh, yes, see? See? -[sighs]
